wikipedia_page.main: James Cosgrove  was a Byker, Newcastle upon Tyne, England, born concert hall singer and humourist/comedian whose career spanned the 19th and 20th centuries.

response: * Cosgrove James – used the alias J C Scatter – see James Cosgrove
* J. C. Scatter – stage name of James Cosgrove

* James Cosgrove uses stage name of J C Scatter - Songwriter and also a 19C/20C singer of many dialect songs including "Blaydon Races" - from the CD Early Recordings Of Artists From The North East 1904-1933 (on Phonograph, PHCD2K1)
